results.title: Joanjo: a Portuguese tale (K)
results.brief_description: Presents live performance scenes in a Portuguese fishing village which frame an animated sequence of a little boy’s dream of becoming famous and great. His ambitions lead to disaster and he is glad to wake up safe at home. Based on a book by Jan Balet. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Joanie 4 Jackie
results.brief_description: In 1995 Miranda July dropped out of college, moved to Portland, Oregon, and typed up a pamphlet that she imagined would be the start of a revolution of girls and women making movies and sharing them with each other. The pamphlet said: “A challenge and a promise: Lady, you send me your movie and I’ll send you the latest Big Miss Moviola Chainletter Tape.” The Joanie 4 Jackie project involved zines, chainletter tapes, co-star tapes and events.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

results.title: Joan the woman
results.creator_credit: Cardinal Film Corporation and Cecil B. DeMille
results.brief_description: An English soldier on the Western front in WWI dreams of the Maid of Orleans, Joan of Arc, before he goes into battle. De Mille emphasised the mystical reincarnation theme that appeared in MacPherson’s story by superimposing images of a prophetic angel over the main narrative. He also experimented with a new colour process for the recurrent images of fire. It was charismatic opera diva Geraldine Farrar’s second film with DeMille, made the year after the success of ‘Carmen’ and was the director’s first foray into costume drama. Cast includes Geraldine Farrar, Wallace Reid, Theodore Roberts, Raymond Hatton, Hobart Bosworth. From the story by Jeanie MacPherson. Original 1916 score performed by Christian Elliot.

results.title: Joan Sutherland: who's afraid of opera: "The Barber of Seville"
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films, Kroll Productions, Nathan Kroll and Ted Kotcheff
results.brief_description: Joan Sutherland explains the story of the opera “The Barber of Seville” to an audience of three hand puppets. Together with other singers, she performs excerpts from the work. This film is suitable for all ages. Musical direction by Richard Bonygne and performed by the London Symphony Orchestra.

results.title: Joan Sutherland: A Life on the Move
results.brief_description: This video looks at the life of Joan Sutherland, following her around the world as she fulfils performing and recording engagements. It looks at her recording in the studio, performing in operatic productions, relaxing at home in London and in Switzerland, enjoying a barbecue with her family and playing with her grandchild. Rated: G

results.title: Joan Sutherland in concert
results.creator_credit: TVW Enterprises, Western Australian Opera Company, Brian J Smith and Phillip Booth
results.brief_description: Dame Joan Sutherland, “La Stupenda”, accompanied by her husband/arranger and renowned pianist, Richard Bonynge, gives an outstanding performance with a program that is rich and varied from the dramatic to the light-hearted. This full-length recital was recorded at the Perth Concert Hall on 9 March 1982 for television.
results.creator_credit_for_label: TVW Enterprises, Western Australian Opera Company, Brian J Smith and Phillip Booth

results.title: Joan of Arc
results.creator_credit: Sierra Pictures, Walter Wanger and Victor Fleming
results.brief_description: Director Victor Fleming’s final film features Ingrid Bergman as a vivid and luminous Joan of Arc, the 15th-century French peasant girl who led the French in battle against the invading British and was consequently burned at the stake for heresy. Based on the stage play ‘Joan of Lorraine’, by Maxwell Anderson. Cast includes Ingrid Bergman, Jose Ferrer, Ward Bond and Francis L. Sullivan.

results.title: Joan of Arc
results.brief_description:
The story of Jeanne d’Arc as told by popular imagery and paintings.

Credits: Director, Francis Lacassin ; writers, Philippe Erlanger, Francis Lacassin ; photography, Quinto Albicocco ; music, Jean Touzet ; researcher, Regine Pernoud.
Cast: Duncan Elliott, John Prim, Suzanne Aron [narration only].

results.title: Joan of Arc
results.creator_credit: Alliance Atlantis, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Endemol Entertainment, Telecino, Peter Bray and Christian Duguay
results.brief_description: This is a lavishly produced, literal interpretation of the life of the 15th century historical heroine Joan d’Arc. In a tiny village during the Hundred Years’ War, teenager Joan d’Arc (Leelee Sobieski) has been raised by her parents Peter (Powers Boothe) and Isabelle (Jacqueline Bisset), amidst the wreckage continually wrought by British incursions into the area. A devout girl, Joan experiences visions of St Catherine, which lead her to believe that she may be the “Maid of Orleans”, a mythical figure who will lead France to victory over its enemies. Counseled by her local priest (Robert Loggia), Joan pursues her destiny in spite of her father’s wishes. At first supported only by lowly commoners, Joan comes to the attention of the Dauphin, King Charles (Neil Patrick Harris). He uses Joan to unite his quarreling factions and his generals, at first sceptical, are won over by Joan’s startling victories. Awaiting Joan is a disastrous Parisian campaign and betrayal by the Dauphin which leads to her being burned at the stake for heresy. She was declared a saint nearly 500 years after her death.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alliance Atlantis, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Endemol Entertainment, Telecino, Peter Bray and Christian Duguay
